result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin Blake Colvin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin Blake Colvin in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Dustin Blake Colvin.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel has received discovery. For reasons set forth in the record State requests additional time. Court grants request.  
Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Dustin Blake Colvin in court. Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Dustin Blake Colvin.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  
Defense counsel recently appointed and requests more time to review case.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 9/7/22 at 8:30am, Branch 13.
Court order the signature bond to continue as previously set.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Dustin Blake Colvin in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court takes no action on bail at this time.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in Court for pretrial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-15-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot (all stores), RW.

Defendant Dustin Blake Colvin in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dustin Blake Colvin
Current: 2465 N Fond Du Lac Ave, Apt. 3, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 06-13-2022)
Prior: 5479 North 36th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/13/2022 @ 2:30p
